title: AI Adoption Rate Across US Companies
description: Percentage of US firms using AI in production, measured by the Census Bureau's Business Trends and Outlook Survey (BTOS) — the most rigorous measure available. Survey-based estimates from consultancies run 5-10x higher due to self-selected samples.

sources.title: The State of AI in 2023: Generative AI's Breakout Year
sources.excerpt: One-third of respondents say their organizations are using gen AI regularly in at least one business function. AI adoption overall at 55% of survey respondents.

sources.title: Business Trends and Outlook Survey: AI Module Q3 2023
sources.excerpt: 3.8% of US firms reported using AI in production. An additional 6.4% were in testing/pilot phase. Adoption highest in information (18%) and professional services (12%).

sources.title: The State of AI in Early 2024
sources.excerpt: 72% of organizations surveyed now use AI in at least one function, up from 55% the prior year. Generative AI adoption doubled.

sources.title: Business Trends and Outlook Survey: AI Module Q2 2024
sources.excerpt: AI usage among US firms rose to 6.6%, with an additional 9.1% in testing. Information sector at 24%, finance/insurance at 15%.

sources.title: State of Generative AI in the Enterprise Q3 2024
sources.excerpt: 79% of enterprise leaders expect gen AI to transform their industry within 3 years. 42% have gen AI in production, up from 22% a year earlier.

sources.title: The State of AI in 2025
sources.excerpt: AI is now a core part of business strategy for 78% of respondents. 65% report measurable revenue or cost impact from AI deployments.

sources.title: Business Trends and Outlook Survey: AI Module Q2 2025
sources.excerpt: US firm AI usage in production reached 10.2%, with 14.8% in testing. Large firms (500+ employees) at 28%. Adoption accelerating across all sectors.

sources.title: Microsoft 2024 Annual Report
sources.excerpt: Over 60,000 Azure AI customers by end of FY2024, growing nearly 60% YoY. Azure AI revenue reached a $13 billion annual run rate, growing 175% YoY.

sources.title: Salesforce Announces Strong Fourth Quarter Fiscal 2024 Results
sources.excerpt: Salesforce Einstein platform serves over 200 billion AI predictions per day across Customer 360 applications. Einstein 1 platform enables AI-powered apps with low-code development and generative AI assistants.

sources.title: The Anthropic Economic Index: Measuring AI's Real-World Impact
sources.excerpt: Census Bureau rigorous measure finds 9.7% of firms actively using AI, while broader surveys report 78%. Adoption gap driven by definitional differences in what counts as AI use.

sources.title: Stanford AI Index Report 2025
sources.excerpt: 78% of organizations report using AI in at least one business function. Enterprise AI spending grew 45% YoY globally.

sources.title: AI at Work Is Here. Now Comes the Hard Part
sources.excerpt: 75% of knowledge workers now use AI tools. Adoption in enterprises with 500+ employees reached 60%, up from 40% a year prior.

sources.title: The Labor Market Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
sources.publisher: Stanford / World Bank (Hartley, Jolevski, Melo, Moore)
sources.excerpt: 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025. Adoption concentrated among younger, college-educated, higher-earning employees.

sources.title: The Unequal Adoption of ChatGPT Exacerbates Existing Inequalities Among Workers
sources.excerpt: Half of workers in AI-exposed occupations have used ChatGPT; adoption unequal — women 16pp less likely, employer restrictions hinder broader use.

sources.title: The Projected Impact of Generative AI on Future Productivity Growth
sources.excerpt: In about 40% of employment in exposed occupations, at least 50% of tasks will be replaceable. Average labor-cost savings ~25% from current tools, potentially 40% as systems improve.

sources.title: The Anthropic Economic Index: Economic Primitives
sources.excerpt: 49% of jobs now use AI for at least 25% of their tasks (up from 36% in early 2025); widespread adoption could boost US labor productivity by 1.0-1.8 percentage points annually.

sources.title: Uneven geographic and demographic patterns of AI adoption
sources.excerpt: Only ~25% of Information sector businesses using AI; ~2.5% in Accommodation/Food — adoption patterns driven more by workforce composition than income.

sources.title: AI, Productivity, and Labor Markets: A Review of the Empirical Evidence
sources.excerpt: 35.9% of US workers used generative AI by December 2025; adoption is accelerating but remains unevenly distributed across industries and skill levels.

sources.title: AI's Impact on Job Growth
sources.excerpt: Less than 10% of firms using AI regularly as of mid-2025 (BTOS data); ~20% adoption in professional, scientific, and technical industries.

sources.title: Is AI Already Replacing Jobs? A Large-Scale Survey
sources.excerpt: 37.4% of US workers used AI on the job in the past week. Adoption highest among college-educated (52%) and workers earning $100K+ (58%). Survey of 25,000 workers.

sources.title: Gallup Workplace AI Adoption Survey Q4 2025
sources.excerpt: 46% of US workers reported using AI tools at work in Q4 2025, up from 33% in Q1 2025. Adoption driven by white-collar professional and technical roles.

sources.title: Firm Data on AI
sources.excerpt: 69% of firms across US, UK, Germany, and Australia currently use some AI technology (US: 78%). LLM text generation most common (41%). Expected to rise to 75% in 3 years. Larger, more productive, higher-paying firms more likely to adopt.

sources.title: The State of AI: Agents, Innovation, and Transformation (Nov 2025)
sources.excerpt: 88% of organizations use AI in ≥1 function (up from 78%). Gen AI adoption at 71%. But only 7% fully scaled, and just 6% report EBIT impact ≥5%. 62% experimenting with AI agents.

sources.title: Why 96% of Companies Aren't Seeing AI ROI
sources.excerpt: Survey of 180 Fortune 100 executives and 12,000 knowledge workers. 96% of organizations not seeing dramatic improvements in efficiency, innovation, or work quality from AI. Costing Fortune 500 ~$98B/year in lost returns. Workers report feeling 33% more productive individually, but organizational metrics flat.

sources.title: AI-Generated 'Workslop' Is Destroying Productivity
sources.excerpt: Survey of 1,150 US workers: 40% received AI-generated 'workslop' in the past month; each instance cost ~2 hours to deal with. 18% of AI users admitted sending low-quality AI output. Estimated cost: $186/worker/month or ~$9M/year for a 10,000-person org.

sources.title: January 2026 US Labor Market Update: Jobs Mentioning AI Are Growing Amid Broader Hiring Weakness
sources.excerpt: The Indeed AI Tracker reached a high of 4.2% in December 2025...the number of postings mentioning AI measured 134% above February 2020 levels
